The things that you desire are perfectly reasonable and we all want them. Your freedoms, removal of these career politicians that plague virtually every land, a place to call home... These are good things, these are proper things. But the reality is that you'll never escape identity politics. The only way to get to the things you want is by going through those shitty politics, because you'll be blocked at every turn by organized people, who are pretty much religious about their political ideals, if you try to go around them instead of straight through them. The political method requires numbers to be effective... Numbers require a shared identity. You have two choices: Natural identity or artificial identity. 

I speak from experience when I say that artificial identity is weak and easily broken. Race, religion, family... These are natural identity and they're very robust. They fit us all like a pair of gloves and it's so incredibly easy to slip into them. They're as instinctive for us as breathing. We always revert back to them, so why fight this uphill battle? Pick a team and run with it, you'll get so much farther and it's far more fulfilling.

1521392984_19s3iztHV7i3fBN9wyiMhiXECoZvy.body:
It would be fairly trivial to get gamers to use ZeroNet, and inadvertently assist with seeding, if it were made easier to rate limit your seeding, like you can do with torrent clients. A better way to organize your zites list would also be an advantage. Maybe a "recently viewed" segment so users can more easily find what they just looked at in case they don't want to seed it.

A major problem I see is the number of dead links or links to blog zites that don't even have any posts. Best practice for indexes and search lists should be to prune those. Sadly I can't even find contact information for some of these indexes in order to inform them of broken links.

I also noticed the absence of working clear-net gateways... That is definitely proving an issue.

>Depending on your definition of "conflict", there seems to be no good reason to engage in it. I'd much rather live a life of peace and going with the flow than fighting for artificially constructed, effervescent "ideals".

I assume that by conflict he was referring to non-physical conflict, such as arguments and rivalries, that sort of thing. I do see good reason to engage in these things. I affirm the adage that iron sharpens iron. Debate is how I hone myself and rivalry or being antagonized can be quite motivating. It's good to overcome adversity. It makes you stronger.

I like both, they're fun.

>Rivalry? As in wanting to be better than someone at something? That stems purely from the ego and lacks compassion.

I have no philosophical or religious objections to the ego. Ego and compassion are not mutually exclusive, in my experience. How can I understand and empathize with someone else unless I first understand myself?

> [prodigy](#comment_3_1DaTaCBTsLEJn1EpEfiuJQpVuDbZrQncwx): I'm a bit confused about the database schema. I assume that the data is actually stored in SQLite locally? 

I'm not sure if this will help, but here. A little ways down from there it talks about the DB under dbQuery.
https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/#uiserver
It looks like it's storing json within the local sqlite DB since it's running actual SQL queries to request the json data. Then it just syncs the DB.

>Page.cmd("dbQuery", [
>    "SELECT * FROM json ?",
>    {file_name: ["data.json", "content.json"]}
>], (res) => { console.log(res.length) })
